chapter.title: Installing @kernel.product.name@

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: The @kernel.product.name@, or @kernel.product.name.short@ for short, requires Java SE 6 or later to be installed. Java is available from http://www.java.com/ and elsewhere.

section.title: Downloading the ZIP file
section.para: @kernel.product.name@ is distributed as a ZIP file. This can be downloaded from here.

section.title: Linux
section.para: To install the @kernel.product.name@ on Linux, unzip the distribution package to the desired installation directory. For example, to install into /opt:
This creates a directory called virgo-kernel-@bundle.version@ under /opt.

@kernel.product.name@ requires write access to the installation directory, in this case /opt/virgo-kernel-@bundle.version@. Typically this means it must be run as the user that installed it, or the installation directory’s ownership must be changed.

section.title: Microsoft Windows
section.para: To install the @kernel.product.name@ on Windows, unzip the distribution package to the desired installation directory. You should use a zip application such as 7zip, not the built-in folder decompression. Note that both Windows and Java have some issues with long file names and file paths, so we recommend installing to the root directory of your chosen drive.

chapter.section: Post-installation steps Follow the same Post-installation steps as for @product.name@.
